page.title: 06THE HARSH WINTER OF 1981/2
page.content: The winter of 1981/2 was a particularly cold one and caused many problems in the area. The village school was badly effected with all running water and the toilets freezing solid for many days. It was kept open but many children, particularly those living up on the Downs, were unable to get in for a whole week. The heavy snow in the new year caused the roof of Harrietsham's cub hut to collapse and the cubs have had to use the local school while rebuilding and repairs are carried out. Hollingbourne School's Christmas production was The Snowman which turned out to be very appropriate as snowmen were a feature of the school playing field for many weeks after the Christmas holidays.
